p: Oxidative stress occurs when the balance between the generation of reactive oxygen species (ROS) and antioxidant defense systems is impaired (Hosseinian et al., 2018). In diabetes, ROS is generated via different mechanisms and multiple sources, including the enzymatic pathway, nonenzymatic pathway, and also mitochondrial respiratory chain reactions (Palsamy et al., 2010). Hyperglycemia directly induces oxidative stress through the glycation of proteins, autoxidation of glucose, and the enhancement of the mitochondrial production of superoxide anion (Dias et al., 2005; Sheng et al., 2019). Moreover, increased levels of free fatty acids (FFA) in diabetes may also have a role in ROS production since mitochondrial uncoupling and β‐oxidation were increased (King & Loeken, 2004).
